issues.title: Support for KWallet
issues.body: Unfortunately, KWallet, the KDE equivalent to GNOME Keyring, does not support the freedesktop secrets standard. KDE Wallet does have [an api](https://api.kde.org/frameworks/kwallet/html/index.html), though. Can someone implement this, so KDE users won't have to install GNOME Keyring?

issues.title: Password forgotten after logging out/in or reboot
issues.body:
Pithos will remember my password until the system reboots, after which I need to sign in again.  Interestingly, it always remembers my email address.

How can I troubleshoot this? Not sure what other information to provide.

Pithos version: 1.3.1
System: Gentoo
DE/WM: KDE/Kwin

issues.title: HeaderBar
issues.body:
In the course of the ongoing redesigning of Pithos the decision was made to more closely follow the Gnome Shell HIG. While in many ways this is a good thing, one feature of the Gnome Shell HIG, the HeaderBar, will cause Pithos to look out of place on any Desktop Environment other that Gnome.

In an effort to ensure that Pithos does not lose favor with non-Gnome users I took it upon myself to find a way for the HeaderBar to be used without the unfortunate side effects. I believe I have done so.

I have written a wrapper around HeaderBar, with an almost one to one API, that will allow for HeaderBar to be enabled/disabled with one function call and no duplicated code. I have released this wrapper under GPL 2 and request that the Pithos community look into using either it or the ideas it is built upon.

Wrapperbar: https://github.com/ForLoveOfCats/wrapperbar

issues.title: Keyring issue with KDE on Wayland
issues.body:
I'm starting the move to KDE on Wayland, but Pithos isn't running because of a keyring issue. I have the keyring unlocked (SDDM unlocks libsecret "login" on login), and it works just fine in X. Here's the Error Dialog Text:

**Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached**
    You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring

And here's the log running from the command line:
```
ERROR - util:on_get_finish:88 - Failed to get Secret.Service, Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
ERROR - pithos:on_keyring_unlocked:280 - You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring. Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
```
I'd really appreciate a fix for this, since I'd like to use Plasma on Wayland as much as I can.

issues.title: Play Next in song context menu
issues.body: Sometimes I want to not play a song in a playlist without necessarily giving it a negative rating or sleeping it. Maybe I just like a song after it in the playlist better and would rather hear it next? I'm not suggesting that we should be able to play a playlist out of order or have a proper play queue, not that there would even be a point to that with only at most 5 songs to pick from. I just think it would be nice to just be able to click an upcoming song in a playlist and say play this one next.

issues.title: Window sizing edge case with Wayland on GNOME after unmaximizing
issues.body:
If you maximize Pithos and then "hide" it to a MPRIS widget(or also I assume the notification icon?) and then show it again and unmaximize it the window goes to it's minimum size.
![screenshot from 2017-11-25 08-40-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6667703/33231546-66685528-d1bc-11e7-9e0b-a6c087e916a5.png)

In X the window situation is pretty much the opposite. The widow will end up filling about 3/4 of my screen after unmaximizing. That's not great either but it's better than what happens in Wayland.

I've tried various hacks but I can't find anything that works very well. Of the 2 I like the X behavior better. It would be nice if the X and Wayland experiences were a little more consistent.

I will search to see if I can find an upstream bug report related to this or @TingPing if you know anyone in the know upstream maybe you could mention this to them.

I really think that this is something that should be addressed upstream in GNOME.

issues.title: Frequent skips during playback
issues.body: I've started to notice frequent skips in audio during playback, running Pithos 1.4.0 on Ubuntu 17.10.  They're short, maybe a quarter of a second, and seem to occur randomly, maybe once a minute or so.  I'm not sure where to even begin in terms of debugging this issue.  Has anyone seen any similar behaviour?  Is this likely a buffering issue?  I can't imagine it's a network connection problem.  I don't notice any CPU spikes or anything when this happens, either.  Suggestions welcome.

issues.title: Move player logic out of main
issues.body: Still a wip at the moment but I wanted to put in the PR so we could polish it up. currently this PR creates a custom player pipeline and abstracts as much out as possible as far as I can tell. It removes pretty much all gstreamer code from pithos.py. The proxy support and auto plugin install still needs tested.

issues.title: Move the Player logic out of the main class
Switch to pure GObject for networking
issues.body:
We've talked about this a little in the past @TingPing but I've recently been playing around with Soup and have had some success with doing some Pure GObject networking. It's a baby step but checkout this Gist:

https://gist.github.com/JasonLG1979/a0691d08c02f20358dc27b5ecddf9270

It takes a http request header, data, proxy and all and returns the response bytes. I scabbed it into Pandora.py and it returns the same thing as the pure python code. So at some point in the near future I'd like to replace all of our network code with async GObject stuff. That would remove the need for GObjectWorker. The only real sticking point I think is pylast. But really as little of it that we use I could probably write a small "Glast" module?

issues.title: Hide Statusbar
issues.body:
Alright, so I did a quick search through issues, and found #81. It didn't have much about the statusbar, and I didn't read through the whole thing, but I didn't get much on this.

Basically I'm wondering what would be required to hide the statusbar when it's not in use. For example, when pithos is "Getting Songs", the statusbar would be shown, but just about any other time it's empty and eating up space. I'm not familiar with Gtk, or its documentation. What would be required to do this?

issues.title: New Plugin Idea: 10 band Eq.
issues.body: Since a 10 band eq plugin is built into Gstreamer plugins-good https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/data/doc/gstreamer/head/gst-plugins-good-plugins/html/gst-plugins-good-plugins-equalizer-10bands.html the hardest part would be the UI(still not that hard ;P) my thought is to have a few basic presets and allow the user to save their own custom presets, pretty much like every other Eq in any other player. It also opens it up to a potentially interesting feature. We could have an option to link a station to a Eq preset. So for example your hip hop station and classic country stations could have their own presets and they would change automatically as you changed to those stations.

issues.title: UX Papercuts
issues.body:
The purpose of this issue is to establish the existence of , discuss and track small relatively easily fixed user experience bugs. 

A couple guidelines:

1. This is not a place to request new features. We want to polish what we have here.

2. We will do our best to follow the GNOME HIG/design patterns but at the same time also do our best not to ruin the user experience in other Desktop Environments.

issues.title: Proper Ad support
issues.body:
Reading up on the docs and poking though pandora.py I believe I've come up with proper ad support for Pithos. Turns out we were skipping ads all alone. Every playlist for free users contains a "song" that just contains an adToken. We were skipping it by checking for 'songName' in the playlist values.

Proper ad support has it's pluses and minuses.

On the plus side you can actually see ads in the playlist before they play, we would be supporting Pandora's revenue stream(no Pandora, no Pithos) since the ads can be "registered" so Pandora knows you heard them and hopefully as a side effect of that we could get less ads masquerading as songs.

On the minus side it would probably mean more ads for free users(Pandora One users never get ads). As I said before so far in my tests there's been an ad in just about every playlist.(so every 5th track), although there's still nothing to stop people from skipping them if they want.

Here's a screenshot of an upcoming ad in the playlist of my testing free account.

![screenshot from 2016-04-17 05-28-21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/14586485/4ddc1c0a-045f-11e6-9d2b-ff9805fab680.png)

issues.title: Extend plugin interface
issues.body:
I know the plans are to eventually allow for the loading of user/3rd party plugins. I might try to implement this in the future. My thought is that it should be pretty straight forward. (You can drop a plugin into Pithos right now and it'll work just fine if you know where to put it.) The user would open the prefs and in the plugins tab they'd click an "add plugin"(or whatever) button and Pithos would open a file dialog the user would select the plugin and Pithos would (try to) load it and save the plugin to a hidden folder somewhere in the user's home dir. And any 3rd party plugin would have a "remove" button by it to (you guessed it) delete it from said hidden folder and delete the pref values in gsettings.

My questions are:
Where would you like the "user plugins" folder to be?
And what are the "rules" as far as what a 3rd party plugin can do? Maybe some guidelines in the wiki?

issues.title: New UI Mockup
issues.body:
![mockup](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/13503521/6c793514-e135-11e5-86c2-77147c67547a.png)

It's been a while since I've brought it up. Since then all the major DE's have added support for headerbars. Those that don't support menus in the panel put them in a button on the headerbar(usually on the far left) This design leaves plenty of room for those menus and extra minimize and maximize buttons. It also falls more in line with the look of modern GNOME apps.

Since we can not seek the slider was replaced with a dual purpose progress bar that would show the track progress while playing and the buffer progress while buffering. 

My main inspiration was GNOME Music.

![music-screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/13503738/bd86b318-e136-11e5-9058-90793cd54f4b.png)

issues.title: Multiple issues with notification area icon under MATE
issues.body:
Several behaviors of the notification area icon (at least under the MATE desktop) changed in a negative way with Pithos 1.1.2:
- left-click on the icon used to toggle the window being visible or not, now it just brings up the same context menu as right-click
- hovering on the icon used to show the current song info, now does nothing
- using the mouse scroll wheel on the icon used to adjust the application volume up or down (depending on scroll direction); now it adjusts the system volume instead and it always goes up (no matter the scroll direction)

This is all on Fedora 23. Installing Pithos 1.1.1 instead brings back the old behavior, so it doesn't appear to be directly tied to OS/desktop environment changes.

issues.title: Make use of lastfm provider in Gnome Online Accounts
issues.body:
Would be nice to integrate with Gnome better on this one, pretty easy to do but the way we currently handle preference dialogs doesn't allow this to be cleanly done I don't think.

Snippet from gnome-music:

``` python
    def _check_last_fm(self):
        try:
            self.last_fm = None
            gi.require_version('Goa', '1.0')
            from gi.repository import Goa
            client = Goa.Client.new_sync(None)
            accounts = client.get_accounts()

            for obj in accounts:
                account = obj.get_account()
                if account.props.provider_name == "Last.fm":
                    self.last_fm = obj.get_oauth2_based()
                    return
        except Exception as e:
            logger.info("Error reading Last.fm credentials: %s" % str(e))
            self.last_fm = None
```

To prompt adding a new account one can launch the control center like:

``` sh
gnome-control-center online-accounts add - lastfm
# Note: The - is there because of a counting error? Fix upstream...
# Also probably activatable from dbus
```

issues.title: Strange issue with playback stoppage and audio quality
issues.body:
I apologize in advance because this bug report is going to be very nebulous. I don't have much (really, any) data at this point, but would like to work with you to debug this problem.

Fairly often it seems, Pithos will finish a song, and then stop playing. It could have been running for a ong time, or for just a few songs. The next song will be buffered, but it won't start, and oddly enough, the play/pause button still shows the pause bars (so there hasn't been a state toggle to paused).

When the pause button is pressed, it stays in the "play state" (showing double bars) and the song starts, but there is a clicking every second or two. Think "radio too close to a spark source" type of clicking. The only way to fix it I've found so far is restarting Pithos.

Very little network traffic at the time, so I don't _think_ that's it. Very low CPU activity too I'm pretty sure, but could be wrong (maybe it spikes so briefly I don't notice it).

This is Ubuntu (Kubuntu) 14.04. The audio is going through a USB headset. Have not tried to see if this happens with just the system analog speakers.

issues.title: Warn user if throttling might be occurring
issues.body:
Users often do not realize that certain behavior causes "throttling" (purposefully reducing bandwidth on the part of Pandora) to occur. Further, from a user-perspective it might not be clear whether throttling is happening or whether there is a bug in Pithos. For related discussion, see #113.

Note that I have a Pandora One account and do not skip many songs so I have not experienced throttling. This is just to say that I will not be able to test any patches for this feature.

issues.title: Application menu takes up extra space on most desktops
issues.body:
On any window manager other than Gnome 3 or Unity, the new GTK3 "Pithos" menu takes up an extra line and is really space inefficient.  Please bring back the old gear icon for non-Gnome-3 WMs.  (If I used Gnome 3 or Unity, I'd still prefer the gear to having to find the menu in the upper left, but I don't actually use those WMs so I don't really care about them.)

![pithos_1 0 0_menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/58860/2874003/ac9ca022-d3cc-11e3-828a-abb8f1721ddd.png)

issues.title: Station buttons in top bar
issues.body: Currently, the Manage Stations button is in the Pithos menu dropdown.  It would be easier to access in the top bar.  Also, the Add Station is inside the Manage Stations screen, though it also deserves a button.

issues.title: Save / export playlist
issues.body: The list of songs Pandora has selected would be nice to keep for later.

issues.title: View starred songs
issues.body: The list of starred tracks is very useful info.  It'd be great to access this info in one big view or grouped by station.  Also, exporting this info to the clipboard or txt would be great too.

issues.title: Info button dropdown: Copy {artist | track | artist & track}
issues.body: Copying song information to the clipboard would be helpful for looking up more info about the artist or track.  The Pandora site is just one place where a user would be interested in looking up the song or artist.

issues.title: Add thumb up and thumb down button to songs_treeview
issues.body:
So, I was going to try to help add this, but I've never used GTK and Glade has decided it won't open the ui files so I only have the barest idea of where the work would need to be done from reading the source.

Anyway, I would suggest rather than (or in addition to) Right Click -> Love Song (or Ban Song, etc), there be the canonical 'thumb up' and 'thumb down' icons in the bottom right corner of each song_treeview (I think that refers to each row/song, yes?).

issues.title: No support for SOCKS 5 proxies
issues.body:
Pithos doesn't support SOCKS 5 proxies because it automatically assumes a proxy is an HTTP proxy.

One consequence of this is that Tor can't be used with it, which deprives people outside the US (like people on vacation) of a way to listen to Pandora and which deprives people who want it of limited anonymity.

**_Note**_: it's easy to have Tor use only US exit nodes by putting `ExitNodes {us}` in `torrc` and restarting Tor.

issues.title: Windows support
issues.body:
After the move to Gtk3 using the [PyGObject for Windows](https://sourceforge.net/projects/pygobjectwin32/) project Pithos almost works on Windows. GDBus(required for gtkapplication) and GStreamer still have some issues though.

The plugins have already been ported to Windows in my [Pithos for Windows](https://github.com/TingPing/pithos-for-windows/tree/master/pithos/plugins) project.
- [x] Get it working
- [ ] Create installer

Fix up win-pos code a bit.

1. Don't bother reading or setting the window position in Wayland.
2. self.settings['win-pos'] can never be (None, None) but self.get_position() can be.
3. Block the configure event handler when we move the window.

The bug has been reported upstream with a test case/app. See: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=790636

Work Around Broken Notification Servers (#541)

Deepin's notification system is broken, see: https://github.com/gnumdk/lollypop/issues/1203
This will stop exceptions by ignoring parameters and send a warning message about the broken signal.

This also fixes a workaround for GNOME sending multiple redundant 'NotificationClosed' signals.

The original workaround breaks actions in KNotifications because KNotifications does not increment the notification id's as they should. Instead each app has it's own id. Including signal_value in self._last_signal make it work for both.

And covers about anything else that can go wrong in do_g_signal as gracefully as possible.

Make Pandora error string more clear.

as discussed in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/535

I noticed imcomplete error messages while debugging https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/534

Fix logging.root.handlers getting reset and KeyError when using -last-logs command line arg

fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/518

Fix TypeError in DBusServiceObject.py

fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/516

Remove pycache files from git

We can't use the GstAudio constants

As much as I would prefer to use the GstAudio.AUDIO_RESAMPLER_QUALITY_MAX and GstAudio.AudioResamplerFilterMode.FULL constants, they don't exist in the version of Gstreamer that ships with *buntu 16.04. Trying to use them in *buntu 16.04 crashes Pithos.

Instead just set "quality" and "sinc-filter-mode" to the values the constants would be if they existed...
We create and delete stations but don't append or remove them from pandora.stations as we should. this fixes that.
Ensure that the notification icon and journald logging plugin prefs windows are not destroyed when they recieve a delete event
Handle socket errors in pandora.py

notification_icon: Improve tray support detection

Closes #491

song.title should not be a property

If song.title is a decorated property with a getter that means that the 1st thing to access it has to potentially do a blocking network call. It just so happens that the 1st thing to access song.title does so from the main thread. Doing blocking calls from the main thread is ofc bad. This instead moves checking the title to init to make sure that any blocking calls are done from a worker thread.

Eq fixup

Save a default state(eq flat) if there is no plugin['data'] value yet. Fixes an exception at the 1st run of the plugin.
Sort Plugins Alphabetically
Fix Typo in auto_volume_normalization.py

Use trackGain from Pandora to fake a ReplayGain Plugin

Use the ReplayGain Gstreamer Elements in conjunction with the trackGain from Pandora to create a "Auto Volume Normalization" plugin.
Add a 10 Band Eq plugin

We don't have to lie about being able to seek any longer

The visibility of the position slider in https://github.com/JasonLG1979/gnome-shell-extensions-mediaplayer was decoupled from the CanSeek prop a while ago. As long as a Player provides a length in the metadata and can provide a valid postion the slider is visible. CanSeek determines if the slider is reactive. For Pithos that means the slider is visible but can't be moved by the user.

Only emit metadata changed signals if we have to.

Metadata is the most "expensive" property to deal with for clients. This cuts our Metadata updates to the bare minimum.

Fix notification icon plugin loosing position

This fixes the notification icon loosing position when it shows the window.

Override present and present_with_time

This should make sure our position is never lost.

Add dummy setters for the rest of the Read/Write MPRIS props.

There is no way by spec to tell clients these props can't be set so we need to deal with a client trying as gracefully as we can.
Properly save window position

Don't GoTo songs that are banned or tired.

A user shouldn't be able to GoTo a song that is banned or tired because Pithos will just skip that banned or tired song and play the next song. In the case the song is banned or tired it makes more sense to do nothing. It's more of an expected behaviour then playing a song that wasn't selected(the next song).

First steps in making plugins GObjects

This is the 1st step in making plugins GObjects. This allows us to potentially to do a bunch of neat stuff. For now this particular commit fixes a bug where when enabling a plugin with a prefs window the prefs button is not sensitive until you click off somewhere else and back on that plugin. This was caused because our plugins now load async.

more complete pandora error enums cont

Prevent potential buffer hang

React to the buffer message immediately and also fire a short repeating timeout to check the buffering state that cancels only if we're not buffering or there's a pending timeout. This will insure we don't get stuck in a buffering state if we're really not buffering.

Show dialog when trying to add station with existing seed.

As mentioned in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/385 Pandora does not allow multiple stations with the same seed. If you try to create a station with an existing seed it will fail and Pandora will just return the station containing the exsisting seed. currently we do not check for this and we blindly just add the station to the station model, which if it already exsists leads to a duplicate station. This fixes that by checking if the returned station already exsists and if it does it pops up a dialog telling the user that a new station could not be created and gives them the option to listen to the exsisting station that contains the seed they were trying to use to create a new station with.

Silence Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size...

Gtk spams us with:

Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size to SearchDialog ... without calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate?

Every time we get search results. This will shut Gtk up by making the dialog non-resizable.

https://github.com/pithos/pithos/commit/bdf52ae5a1133373ded8c02012f4e9ffa0c35339 added an *ignore to pandora_connect that swallowed up the args. This fixes that by converting them to kwargs. Fixes https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/369

Improved buffering behavior

This improves buffering behavior in a few ways.

1st, It changes how we deal with buffering signals. Since the buffering percent that is received in the buffering message is pretty much useless this uses a buffering query to get a bool representing if the pipeline is buffering or not. We then respond to that bool accordingly.

2nd, It Enumerates the player states to give us a BUFFERING state. We can then use those Enums to clearly differentiate between PAUSED and BUFFERING.

3rd, It makes the timeout longer in souphttpsrc to give the user time to reconnect in the case of a network disconnect.

And finally it makes Pithos behave as you would expect during buffering as far as user initiated state changes. As in the pipeline doesn't actually change state until buffering completes at which time it goes to the correct state, whatever that may be.

Another positive side effect of this is that it puts the end to the UI thrashing during buffering.

A song is considered valid if there is enough time for the song to play in it's entirety before the playlist has expired.

mpris: Send empty return value for DBUS methods.

When something calls a DBUS method, it waits for a reply even for a method
that doesn't have a return value. So, if you don't send a (possibly empty)
return value, then the caller will hang until it times out.

So, in DBusServiceObject.__dbus_method_call, if the method doesn't have a
return value, then call g_dbus_method_invocation_return_value anyway, with
None for a parameter.

Previous commit broke user pausing while buffering. Fixed.
Adding some debug logging to make the flow very clear.

Buffering fixes.

* Pithos was setting gstreamer to PLAY state initially.
  Gstreamer docs recommend starting playbin in PAUSED state
  and waiting for the buffer to fill before PLAYING. Fixed.

* Removed unnecessary if statement in on_gst_buffering.

* Manually set the gstreamer buffer size to 3 seconds at 192kbps.
  This is more than needed for 64bit AACs, but the only downside
  to a larger buffer is a bit of a pause at the beginning of a
  song (depending on network speed, latency, etc.)

pull_requests.title: Move player logic out of main
pull_requests.body: Still a wip at the moment but I wanted to put in the PR so we could polish it up. currently this PR creates a custom player pipeline and abstracts as much out as possible as far as I can tell. It removes pretty much all gstreamer code from pithos.py. The proxy support and auto plugin install still needs tested.

I'm sorry, but I disagree. While better plugin support would be nice to have, proxy auto-configuration is usually something that is built into the core application and not something provided by a plugin. In addition to this, plugin support is implemented by providing hooks around general functionality in the core application that plugins can choose to override in order to provide additional functionality. I don't foresee a lot of third-party plugins centred around overriding Pithos's proxy configuration.

I'd rather package the pac-parsing module with Pithos if that would be a more acceptable solution, but I don't think rewriting this as a plugin would improve matters.

How about moving the package dependency from Depends to Suggest and importing the module in a try/catch block, only providing the feature if the module is installed? (Maybe passively indicating to the user that he's not getting the feature because the module is not there?)

On a separate note, couldn't you pass the return value of urlopen directly to parse_pac rather than creating a tempfile (that by the way you do not cleanup?): 

pacparser.parse_pac(urllib2.urlopen(control_proxy_pac))

At the very least I'd suggest using this: http://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html
`pacparser` has a method named `parse_pac_string`, removing the need for a temporary file.

> I'm sorry, but I disagree. While better plugin support would be nice to have, proxy auto-configuration is usually something that is built into the core application and not something provided by a plugin. 

+1

> How about moving the package dependency from Depends to Suggest and importing the module in a try/catch block, only providing the feature if the module is installed?

I like this idea.

You could also package the software for Fedora and Arch. I like this idea even more.

You could also not rely on the package and implement the functionality yourself. (I suppose not much different than bundling with Pithos, although I think including deps is frowned upon at least in Fedora packaging.)

Just to be clear, the dep we are talking about is https://code.google.com/p/pacparser/ ?

@gregsheremeta Yep, that's the dependency. I like @obadz's suggestion, because the pacparser module is written in C and wrapped in python, so I'm not sure how packaging it would work (package the compiled binary?), and rewriting it in pure python would be well beyond my python skills.

Speaking for Fedora, you'd have a package for the C library (that uses the C source code, but the RPM payload is the library binary) and then a second package for the python wrapper (source and payload are the same here).

Let's get @TingPing 's opinion -- but I'd encourage you to do the packaging work :) They would be simple to package for Fedora. @TingPing can guide -- he is an experienced packager. (I am not.)

Could you try running this small script and see what happen when you scroll over the status icon?

``` python
#!/usr/bin/python

import gtk

class StatusIcon:
    def scroll(x, y, steps):
        print 'Scroll - %s' % steps

    def __init__(self):
        self.statusicon = gtk.StatusIcon()
        self.statusicon.set_from_stock(gtk.STOCK_HOME) 
        self.statusicon.connect("popup-menu", self.right_click_event)
        self.statusicon.connect("scroll-event", self.scroll)
        self.statusicon.set_tooltip("StatusIcon Example")

        window = gtk.Window()
        window.connect("destroy", lambda w: gtk.main_quit())
        window.show_all()

    def right_click_event(self, icon, button, time):
        menu = gtk.Menu()

        about = gtk.MenuItem("About")
        quit = gtk.MenuItem("Quit")

        about.connect("activate", self.show_about_dialog)
        quit.connect("activate", gtk.main_quit)

        menu.append(about)
        menu.append(quit)

        menu.show_all()

        menu.popup(None, None, gtk.status_icon_position_menu, button, time, self.statusicon)

    def show_about_dialog(self, widget):
        about_dialog = gtk.AboutDialog()

        about_dialog.set_destroy_with_parent(True)
        about_dialog.set_name("StatusIcon Example")
        about_dialog.set_version("1.0")
        about_dialog.set_authors(["Andrew Steele"])

        about_dialog.run()
        about_dialog.destroy()

StatusIcon()
gtk.main()
```

After playing around a bit it seems that gi.require_version() doesn't work well with minor versions so I wrote this:

```
import gi
try:
    gi.require_version('Gst', '1.0')
except ValueError:
    #Tell the user the problem so they can fix it
    logging.error("Gstreamer 1.0 is required to run Pithos.")
    sys.exit()
from gi.repository import Gst, GObject, Gtk, Gdk, Pango, GdkPixbuf, Gio, GLib
#Check version of GTK
gtkVersion = str(Gtk.get_major_version())+"."+str(Gtk.get_minor_version())
gtkVersion = float(gtkVersion)
if gtkVersion <= 3.8:
    logging.error("GTK 3.8 or higher is required to run Pithos")
    sys.exit()
```

In this case you just replace the 3.8 in the if statement for what version of GTK you require.

sudo apt-get remove
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install pithos

Ok this is like 7 completely unrelated changes so I'll go down the list of my very basic opinions and you can open separate pull requests.
- **Unity Stuff**: Throws errors on my system without Unity, haven't tested with it.
- **Downloading Songs**: I don't want this, Pandora does not allow this functionality (for obvious reasons) and neither will we within the core, write a plugin for that if you want. Also mutagen doesn't support Python 3 anyway.
- **Back Button**: Same as previous point really, though I am less opinionated on it.
- **Progress Bar**: I like this but I am not a huge fan of the design of it.
- **Other UI Changes**: I don't see the purpose of the reload button really or making the window larger.

- **Unity Stuff**: The error you see is due to the fact that there was some unity stuff in the MPRIS class. I'll fix it in the next commit.
- **Downloading songs**: I'm not sure how to do that, but I'll try to move the code to a separate module. Anyway there are ports of mutagen to py3: https://github.com/LordSputnik/mutagen
- **Back button**: Like the previous feature, you could show at the first launch a popup that says something like "do not use it", so that you are _virtually ok_ with Pandora Media (I think...)
- **Progress bar**: I actually wanted to use a scale that triggered Gstreamer's seek feature, but the application crashed, and the last thing I wanted was dealing with Gst crashes. Therefore, as I didn't like the design of the insensitive scale, I used the progressbar. It would have been prettier if it was thin like Android's one, but I don't know how to achieve that...
- **Other ui changes**: The reload songs button makes the program add songs to the bottom of the playlist, so that you have more choice. But there's still the problem that if you load too many playlist Pandora will block that feature, which is the main reason why I went to bed yesterday :D Anyway I think the window was too small, I could barely see the playing song and it was unconfortable to scroll. I think that at least two elements should be visible.

I was also trying to make it hide the windows when closing it while playing and showing it again when clicking the sound menu item, but I couldn't get it working. I'll add an item to the quicklist maybe.

> you could show at the first launch a popup that says something like "do not use it", so that you are virtually ok with Pandora Media

No, downloading songs directly from Pandora will never be _OK_ for them.

As for the others, once you have these features in their own branches we can discuss them in more detail =)

Alright, with the last commit the download button is in its own plug-in, and enabling it from the settings will cause a disclaimer to show up, telling the users that none of the developers can be held responsible for anything and that they have to accept to make a legal use of the plug-in (downloading songs that they already own, for example on a CD). Honestly, man, it's really not cool with me. I like Pandora and I don't feel comfortable doing anything shady. This is shady. I want to stay legit.

Any chance you could host the plugin on your site or something? Make it be a completely separate thing? I'm not familiar with the plugin architecture, so if it's not feasible, I'm afraid you'll have to remain a fork.

Well, I would, but Pithos' plugin engine is not very extendable: there's nothing like an automatic generated page on the settings that looks the system for plug-ins and adds checkboxes for them. To enable a plug-in there must be an hardcoded checkbox in the preferences window module, otherwise as of now there's no other way to enable it.

> there's nothing like an automatic generated page on the settings that looks the system for plug-ins and adds checkboxes for them.

Something like this is planned, see #25. You will just have to wait for that to be completed and throw it in your own repo.

Changed this to:

```
        # Try to use the generic audio MIME type icon from the user's current theme
        # for the cover image if we don't get one from Pandora
        # Workaround for:
        # https://github.com/eonpatapon/gnome-shell-extensions-mediaplayer/issues/248

        if song.artUrl is not None:
            artUrl = song.artUrl
        else:
            icon_sizes = Gtk.IconTheme.get_icon_sizes(Gtk.IconTheme.get_default(), 'audio-x-generic')
            if -1 in icon_sizes:# -1 is a scalable icon(svg)
                best_icon = -1
            else:
                icon_sizes = sorted(icon_sizes, key=int, reverse=True)
                best_icon = icon_sizes[0] 
            icon_info = Gtk.IconTheme.get_default().lookup_icon('audio-x-generic', best_icon, 0)
            artUrl = "file://%s" %icon_info.get_filename()
```

No more guessing icon sizes.

@JasonLG1979 
I think that's because you need to compile the gschema in the `meson_post_install.py`, `gnome.compile_schemas ()` used in `data/meson.build` is only used to compile locally in the current dir. So the schema is currently only being moved to the `[datadir]/glib-2.0/schemas` dir, not compiled.

Try adding adding the following under the `if not destdir:` block in `meson_post_install.py`:
```python
print ('Compiling GSettings schemas...')
schemas_dir = os.path.join (datadir, 'glib-2.0', 'schemas')
if not os.path.exists (schemas_dir):
    os.makedirs (schemas_dir)
subprocess.call (['glib-compile-schemas', '--strict', schemas_dir])
```

also updating the desktop cache might be a good idea:
```python
print ('Updating desktop database...')
desktop_database_dir = os.path.join (datadir, 'applications')
if not os.path.exists (desktop_database_dir):
    os.makedirs (desktop_database_dir)
subprocess.call (['update-desktop-database', '-q', desktop_database_dir])
```
@julianrichen Right, just overlooked that. We don't need to update the desktop database though as we don't handle any mime types.

This might be helpful for you: https://python-gtk-3-tutorial.readthedocs.org/en/latest/objects.html

A property seems a bit simpler than a signal for this.

pandora.py:

``` python
class Pandora(GObject.Object):
    ...
    connected = GObject.Property(type=bool, default=False)
    ...
    def connect(...):
        ...
        self.connected = True
    ...
```

pithos.py:

``` python
pandora.connect('notify::connected', ...)
```

    def sync_explicit_content_filter_setting(self, *ignore):
        #reset checkbox to default state

        self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_sensitive(False)

        if self.pandora.connected:

            def sync_checkbox(pin_protected):

                if pin_protected:

                else:
                    self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_sensitive(True)

            self.worker_run(get_filter_and_pin_protected_state, (), sync_checkbox)

+        so that later when clients refer to songs by their trackid we can extract the song.index for use
+        in Pithos for things like skipping to, or rating a specific song in a tracklist.
+
+        https://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#message-protocol-marshaling-object-path

+        """

+        if song is self.window.current_song:#we only care about the current song
+            self.PropertiesChanged(self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE,
+            {'Metadata': dbus.Dictionary(self._update_metadata(song),
+            signature='sv'), }, [])
+
+    def _unique_trackid_generator(self, window, song):
+        """The trackid must be a unique and valid object path for each song, although the path does not
+        have to actually point to anything. We use the song.index as our starting point for our trackid
+        so that later when clients refer to songs by their trackid we can extract the song.index for use
+        in Pithos for things like skipping to, or rating a specific song in a tracklist.
+
+        https://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#message-protocol-marshaling-object-path
+        https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mpris-spec/latest/Player_Interface.html#Property:Metadata
+        https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mpris-spec/latest/Track_List_Interface.html#Mapping:Metadata_Map
+        """
+        random_string = ''.join(random.SystemRandom().choice(string.ascii_letters + string.digits) for x in range(56))
+        self._unique_trackid = ('/org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/%s%s' %(song.index, random_string))
+        self._valid_trackids.append(self._unique_trackid)
+        logging.info("MPRIS trackid for %s by %s: %s"%(song.title, song.artist, self._unique_trackid))
+
+    def _song_index_from_trackid(self, trackid):
+        """Extracts the song.index from a trackid by slicing the object path
+        from the begining and the random numbers from the end.
+        """
+        return int(trackid[34:-56])
review_comments.body: The string is the MPRIS trackId. It contains the required '/org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/' + song_index + a random string of letters and numbers. The trackid must be unique as per the MPRIS docs. It's how MPRIS clients refer to the song. For example ' /org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/1D5VDR0XZ6PDlfoD4QppsZesf6AXOjK0hCLzVDPIgHqARoAXcPn3Ekw49'. self._song_index_from_trackid takes the trackid and turns it back to a song index for the purpose of rating the song.

+#
+# Copyright (C) 2016 Jason Gray <jasonlevigray3@gmail.com>
+#
+# This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it
+# under the terms of the GNU General Public License version 3, as published

+# MERCHANTABILITY, SATISFACTORY QUALITY, or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
+# PURPOSE.  See the GNU General Public License for more details.
+#
+# You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
+# with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
+# END LICENSE
+
+import logging
+
+from gi.repository import GObject, Gtk
+
+from pithos.plugin import PithosPlugin
+
+LOG_LEVELS = {
+    'debug': logging.DEBUG,
+    'verbose': logging.INFO,
+    'warning': logging.WARN,
+}
+
+
+class JournalLoggingPlugin(PithosPlugin):
+    preference = 'journald-logging'
+    description = _('Store logs with the journald service')
+
+    _logging_changed_handler = None
+
+    def on_prepare(self):
+        try:
+            from systemd.journal import JournalHandler
+            self._journal = JournalHandler(SYSLOG_IDENTIFIER='io.github.Pithos')
+            self._journal.setFormatter(logging.Formatter())
+            self._logger = logging.getLogger()
+            self.preferences_dialog = LoggingPluginPrefsDialog(self.window, self.settings)
+        except ImportError:
+            return _('Systemd Python module not found')
+
+    def on_enable(self):
+        self._on_logging_changed(None, self.settings['data'] or 'verbose')
+        self._logger.addHandler(self._journal)
+        self._logging_changed_handler = self.preferences_dialog.connect('logging-changed', self._on_logging_changed)
+
+    def _on_logging_changed(self, prefs_dialog, level):
+        self.settings['data'] = level
+        self._journal.setLevel(LOG_LEVELS[level])
+        logging.info('setting journald logging level to: {}'.format(level))
+
+    def on_disable(self):
+        if self._logging_changed_handler:
+            self.preferences_dialog.disconnect(self._logging_changed_handler)
+        self._logger.removeHandler(self._journal)
+
+
+class LoggingPluginPrefsDialog(Gtk.Dialog):
+    __gtype_name__ = 'LoggingPluginPrefsDialog'
+    __gsignals__ = {
+        'logging-changed': (GObject.SignalFlags.RUN_FIRST, None, (GObject.TYPE_STRING,)),
+    }
+
+    def __init__(self, parent, settings, *args, **kwargs):
+        super().__init__(
+            _('Logging Level'),
+            parent,
+            0,
+            ('_Cancel', Gtk.ResponseType.CANCEL, '_Apply', Gtk.ResponseType.APPLY),
+            *args,
+            use_header_bar=1,
+            **kwargs,
+        )
+
+        self.settings = settings
+        self.set_resizable(False)
+        self.connect('response', self._on_response)
+
+        sub_title = Gtk.Label.new(_('Set the journald logging level for Pithos'))
+        sub_title.set_halign(Gtk.Align.CENTER)
+        self.log_level_combo = Gtk.ComboBoxText.new()
+
+        logging_levels = [
+            ('debug', 'High - debug'),
+            ('verbose', 'Default - verbose'),
+            ('warning', 'Low - warning'),
+        ]
+
+        for level in logging_levels:
+            self.log_level_combo.append(level[0], level[1])
+
+        self._reset_combo()
+        content_area = self.get_content_area()
+
+        content_area.add(sub_title)
+        content_area.add(self.log_level_combo)
+        content_area.show_all()
+
+    def _reset_combo(self):
+        self.log_level_combo.set_active_id(self.settings['data'] or 'verbose')
+
+    def _on_response(self, dialog, response):
+        if response != Gtk.ResponseType.APPLY:
+            self.hide()
+            self._reset_combo()
+            return
+
+        setting = self.settings['data']
+        active_id = self.log_level_combo.get_active_id()
+
+        if setting == active_id:
+            self.hide()
+            return
+
+        if active_id != 'debug':
+            self.hide()
+            self.emit('logging-changed', active_id)
+            return
+
+        def on_dialog_response(dialog, response):
+            if response == Gtk.ResponseType.YES:
+                self.hide()
+                self.emit('logging-changed', active_id)
+            dialog.destroy()
+
+        message = (_('The debug logging level is not '
+                   'recommended unless you are actually debugging an issue, '
+                   'as it generates very large logs.\n\nAre you sure you want to set logging to debug?'))

+class PithosMprisService(DBusServiceObject):
+    MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE = 'org.mpris.MediaPlayer2'
+    MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE = 'org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.Player'
+    MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE = 'org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.Playlists'
+    MEDIA_PLAYER2_TRACKLIST_IFACE = 'org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.TrackList'
+
+    # As per https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/mpris/2012q4/000054.html
+    # Secondary mpris interfaces to allow for options not allowed within the
+    # confines of the mrpis spec are a completely valid use case.
+    # This interface allows clients to love, ban, set tired and unrate songs.
+    MEDIA_PLAYER2_RATINGS_IFACE = 'org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.ExtensionPithosRatings'
+
+    TRACK_OBJ_PATH = '/io/github/Pithos/TrackId/'
+    NO_TRACK_OBJ_PATH = '/org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/NoTrack'
+    PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH = '/io/github/Pithos/PlaylistId/'
+
+    NO_TRACK_METADATA = {
+        'mpris:trackid': GLib.Variant('o', NO_TRACK_OBJ_PATH),
+    }
+
+    def __init__(self, window, **kwargs):
+        '''Creates a PithosMprisService object.'''
+        super().__init__(object_path='/org/mpris/MediaPlayer2', **kwargs)
+        self.window = window
+
+    def _reset(self):
+        '''Resets state to default.'''
+        self._volume = math.pow(self.window.player.props.volume, 1.0 / 3.0)
+        self._metadata = self.NO_TRACK_METADATA
+        self._metadata_list = [self.NO_TRACK_METADATA]
+        self._tracks = [self.NO_TRACK_OBJ_PATH]
+        self._playback_status = 'Stopped'
+        self._playlists = [('/', '', '')]
+        self._current_playlist = False, ('/', '', '')
+        self._orderings = ['CreationDate']
+        self._stations_dlg_handlers = []
+        self._window_handlers = []
+        self._stations_dlg_handlers = []
+        self._volumechange_handler_id = None
+        self._sort_order_handler_id = None
+
+    def connect(self):
+        '''Takes ownership of the Pithos mpris Interfaces.'''
+        self._reset()
+
+        def on_name_acquired(connection, name):
+            logging.info('Got bus name: {}'.format(name))
+            self._update_handlers()
+            self._connect_handlers()

+        self.bus_id = Gio.bus_own_name_on_connection(

+    def disconnect(self):
+        '''Disowns the Pithos mpris Interfaces.'''

+    def _update_handlers(self):
+        '''Updates signal handlers.'''
+        # Update some of our dynamic props if mpris

+        window = self.window
+        station = self.window.current_station
+        song = self.window.current_song

+        if station:
+            self._current_playlist_handler(

+            )
+
+            self._update_playlists_handler(

+            self._songs_added_handler(

+        self._sort_order_handler()
+
+    def _connect_handlers(self):
+        '''Connects signal handlers.'''
+        window = self.window
+        self._window_handlers = [
+            window.connect(
+                'metadata-changed',
+                self._metadatachange_handler,
+            ),
+
+            window.connect(
+                'play-state-changed',
+                self._playstate_handler,
+            ),
+
+            window.connect(
+                'buffering-finished',
+                lambda window, position: self.Seeked(position // 1000),
+            ),
+
+            window.connect(
+                'station-changed',
+                self._current_playlist_handler,

+
+            window.connect(

+        self._sort_order_handler_id = window.settings.connect(

+    def _disconnect_handlers(self):

+
+        if self._sort_order_handler_id:
+            window.settings.disconnect(self._sort_order_handler_id)
+
+    def _stations_dlg_ready_handler(self, *ignore):
+        '''Connects stations dialog handlers.'''
+        stations_dlg = self.window.stations_dlg
+        self._stations_dlg_handlers = [
+            stations_dlg.connect(
+                'station-renamed',
+                self._rename_playlist_handler,
+            ),
+
+            stations_dlg.connect(
+                'station-added',
+                self._add_playlist_handler,
+            ),
+
+            stations_dlg.connect(
+                'station-removed',
+                self._remove_playlist_handler,
+            ),
+        ]
+
+    def _sort_order_handler(self, *ignore):
+        '''Changes the Playlist Orderings Property based on the station popover sort order.'''
+        if self.window.settings['sort-stations']:
+            new_orderings = ['Alphabetical']
+        else:
+            new_orderings = ['CreationDate']
+        if self._orderings != new_orderings:
+            self._orderings = new_orderings
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE,
+                {'Orderings': GLib.Variant('as', self._orderings)},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _update_playlists_handler(self, window, stations):
+        '''Updates the Playlist Interface when stations are loaded/refreshed.'''
+        self._playlists = [(self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH + station.id, station.name, '') for station in stations]
+        self.PropertiesChanged(
+            self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE,
+            {'PlaylistCount': GLib.Variant('u', len(self._playlists))},
+            [],
+        )
+
+    def _remove_playlist_handler(self, window, station):
+        '''Removes a deleted station from the Playlist Interface.'''
+        for index, playlist in enumerate(self._playlists[:]):
+            if playlist[0].strip(self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH) == station.id:
+                del self._playlists[index]
+                self.PropertiesChanged(
+                    self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE,
+                    {'PlaylistCount': GLib.Variant('u', len(self._playlists))},
+                    [],
+                )
+                break
+
+    def _rename_playlist_handler(self, stations_dlg, data):
+        '''Renames the corresponding Playlist when a station is renamed.'''
+        station_id, new_name = data
+        for index, playlist in enumerate(self._playlists):
+            if playlist[0].strip(self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH) == station_id:
+                self._playlists[index] = (self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH + station_id, new_name, '')
+                self.PlaylistChanged(self._playlists[index])
+                break
+
+    def _add_playlist_handler(self, window, station):
+        '''Adds a new station to the Playlist Interface when it is created.'''
+        new_playlist = (self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH + station.id, station.name, '')
+        if new_playlist not in self._playlists:
+            self._playlists.append(new_playlist)
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE,
+                {'PlaylistCount': GLib.Variant('u', len(self._playlists))},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _current_playlist_handler(self, window, station):
+        '''Sets the ActivePlaylist Property to the current station.'''
+        new_current_playlist = (self.PLAYLIST_OBJ_PATH + station.id, station.name, '')
+        if self._current_playlist != (True, new_current_playlist):
+            self._current_playlist = (True, new_current_playlist)
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE,
+                {'ActivePlaylist': GLib.Variant('(b(oss))', self._current_playlist)},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _playstate_handler(self, window, state):
+        '''Updates the mpris PlaybackStatus Property.'''
+        play_state = 'Playing' if state else 'Paused'
+
+        if self._playback_status != play_state: # stops unneeded updates
+            self._playback_status = play_state
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE,
+                {'PlaybackStatus': GLib.Variant('s', self._playback_status)},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _volumechange_handler(self, player, spec):
+        '''Updates the mpris Volume Property.'''
+        volume = math.pow(player.props.volume, 1.0 / 3.0)
+
+        if self._volume != volume: # stops unneeded updates
+            self._volume = volume
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE,
+                {'Volume': GLib.Variant('d', self._volume)},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _songs_added_handler(self, window, songs):
+        '''Adds songs to the TrackList Interface.'''
+        # Replace the old playlist with the new one but make sure to include the current song.
+        self._tracks = [self._track_id_from_song(song) for song in songs]
+        self._metadata_list = [self._get_metadata(window, song) for song in songs]
+        if window.current_song and window.current_song not in songs:
+            self._tracks.insert(0, self._track_id_from_song(window.current_song))
+            self._metadata_list.insert(0, self._get_metadata(window, window.current_song))
+        self.TrackListReplaced(self._tracks, self._tracks[0])
+
+    def _metadatachange_handler(self, window, song):
+        '''Updates the metadata for the Player and TrackList Interfaces.'''
+        # Ignore songs that have no chance of being in our Tracks list.
+        if song.index < max(0, len(window.songs_model) - 5):
+            return
+        metadata = self._get_metadata(window, song)
+        trackId = self._track_id_from_song(song)
+        if trackId in self._tracks:
+            for index, track_id in enumerate(self._tracks):
+                if track_id == trackId:
+                    self._metadata_list[index] = metadata
+                    self.TrackMetadataChanged(trackId, metadata)
+                    break
+        # No need to update the current metadata if the current song has been banned
+        # or set tired as it will be skipped anyway very shortly.
+        if song is window.current_song and not (song.tired or song.rating == 'ban'):
+            self._metadata = metadata
+            self.PropertiesChanged(
+                self.MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE,
+                {'Metadata': GLib.Variant('a{sv}', self._metadata)},
+                [],
+            )
+
+    def _get_metadata(self, window, song):
+        '''Generates metadata for a song.'''
+        # Map pithos ratings to something MPRIS understands
+        userRating = 1.0 if song.rating == 'love' else 0.0
+        duration = self._duration if song is window.current_song else song.trackLength * 1000000
+        pithos_rating = window.song_icon(song) or ''
+        trackid = self._track_id_from_song(song)
+
+        metadata = {
+            'mpris:trackid': GLib.Variant('o', trackid),
+            'xesam:title': GLib.Variant('s', song.title or 'Title Unknown'),
+            'xesam:artist': GLib.Variant('as', [song.artist] or ['Artist Unknown']),
+            'xesam:album': GLib.Variant('s', song.album or 'Album Unknown'),
+            'xesam:userRating': GLib.Variant('d', userRating),
+            'xesam:url': GLib.Variant('s', song.audioUrl),
+            'mpris:length': GLib.Variant('x', duration),
+            'pithos:rating': GLib.Variant('s', pithos_rating),
+        }
+
+        # If we don't have an artUrl the best thing we can
+        # do is not even have 'mpris:artUrl' in the metadata,
+        # and let the applet decide what to do.
+        if song.artUrl is not None:
+            metadata['mpris:artUrl'] = GLib.Variant('s', song.artUrl)
+
+        return metadata
+
+    def _song_from_track_id(self, TrackId):
+        '''Convenience method that takes a TrackId and returns the corresponding song object.'''
+        if TrackId not in self._tracks:
+            return
+        if self.window.current_song_index is None:
+            return
+        songs_model = self.window.songs_model
+        stop = len(songs_model)
+        start = max(0, stop - 5)
+        for i in range(start, stop):
+            song = songs_model[i][0]
+            if TrackId == self._track_id_from_song(song):
+                return song
+
+    def _track_id_from_song(self, song):
+        '''Convenience method that generates a TrackId based on a song.'''
+        return self.TRACK_OBJ_PATH + codecs.encode(bytes(song.trackToken, 'ascii'), 'hex').decode('ascii')
+
+    @property
+    def _duration(self):
+        '''The current song's Duration.'''
+        # use the duration provided by Pandora
+        # if Gstreamer hasn't figured out the duration yet
+        duration = self.window.query_duration()
+        if duration is not None:
+            return duration // 1000
+        else:
+            return self.window.current_song.trackLength * 1000000
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanQuit(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def Fullscreen(self):
+        '''b Read/Write (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return False
+
+    @Fullscreen.setter
+    def Fullscreen(self, Fullscreen):
+        '''Not Implemented'''
+        # Spec says the Fullscreen property should be read/write so we
+        # include this dummy setter for applets that might wrongly ignore
+        # the CanSetFullscreen property and try to set the Fullscreen
+        # property anyway.
+        pass
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanSetFullscreen(self):
+        '''b Read only (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return False
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanRaise(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def HasTrackList(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='s')
+    def Identity(self):
+        '''s Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return 'Pithos'
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='s')
+    def DesktopEntry(self):
+        '''s Read only (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return 'io.github.Pithos'
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='as')
+    def SupportedUriScheme(self):
+        '''as Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return ['', ]
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_IFACE, signature='as')
+    def SupportedMimeTypes(self):
+        '''as Read only Interface MediaPlayer2'''
+        return ['', ]
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='s')
+    def PlaybackStatus(self):
+        '''s Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return self._playback_status
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='s')
+    def LoopStatus(self):
+        '''s Read only (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return 'None'
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def Shuffle(self):
+        '''b Read only (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return False
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='d')
+    def Rate(self):
+        '''d Read only (optional) Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return 1.0
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='a{sv}')
+    def Metadata(self):
+        '''a{sv} Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return self._metadata
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='d')
+    def Volume(self):
+        '''d Read/Write Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        volume = self.window.player.get_property('volume')
+        scaled_volume = math.pow(volume, 1.0 / 3.0)
+        return scaled_volume
+
+    @Volume.setter
+    def Volume(self, new_volume):
+        scaled_vol = math.pow(new_volume, 3.0 / 1.0)
+        self.window.player.set_property('volume', scaled_vol)
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='x')
+    def Position(self):
+        '''x Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        position = self.window.query_position()
+        if position is not None:
+            return position // 1000
+        else:
+            return 0
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='d')
+    def MinimumRate(self):
+        '''d Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return 1.0
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='d')
+    def MaximumRate(self):
+        '''d Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return 1.0
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanGoNext(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')

+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return False
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanPlay(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanPause(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanSeek(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        # This a lie because some sound applets depend upon
+        # this to show song position/duration info
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYER_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanControl(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Player'''
+        return True
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE, signature='(b(oss))')
+    def ActivePlaylist(self):
+        '''(b(oss)) Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Playlists'''
+        return self._current_playlist
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE, signature='u')
+    def PlaylistCount(self):
+        '''u Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Playlists'''
+        return len(self._playlists)
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_PLAYLISTS_IFACE, signature='as')
+    def Orderings(self):
+        '''as Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.Playlists'''
+        return self._orderings
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_TRACKLIST_IFACE, signature='ao')
+    def Tracks(self):
+        '''ao Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.TrackList'''
+        return self._tracks
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_TRACKLIST_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanEditTracks(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.TrackList'''
+        return False
+
+    @dbus_property(MEDIA_PLAYER2_RATINGS_IFACE, signature='b')
+    def CanRate(self):
+        '''b Read only Interface MediaPlayer2.ExtensionPithosRatings'''
+        # This property exists so that applets can check it to make sure
+        # the MediaPlayer2.ExtensionPithosRatings interface actually exists.
+        # It's much more convenient for them then wrapping all their
+        # ratings code in the equivalent of a try except block.
+        # Not all versions of Pithos will have this interface.

review_comments.body:
Whatever is with in a `_()` is picked up for translations and the function just returns a translated string. So you can break up strings how ever you want and only translate parts of it but it should at least be understandable to a translator.

I do realize we don't actually have translations atm but I'd like for that to change.

+                    None,
+                )
+
+        def on_GetCapabilities_finish(self, result, data):
+            try:
+                self._caps = self.call_finish(result).unpack()[0]
+            except GLib.Error as e:
+                callback(None, None, None, error=e)
+            else:
+                self.call(
+                    'GetServerInformation',
+                    None,
+                    Gio.DBusCallFlags.NONE,
+                    -1,
+                    None,
+                    on_GetServerInformation_finish,
+                    None,
+               )
